Instrument.name: InSight Mars Lander Context Camera
Instrument.description: The InSight Mars Lander Context Camera (ICC) instrument was fix-mounted on the body of the lander with a wide angle lens and a view of the arm workspace and some of the sky. The ICC's optics were based on Mars Science Laboratory's Hazcam instrument. Images from the ICC were structured the same as images from the InSight Deployment Camera (IDC), and were treated similarly by both the flight software (FSW) and the ground system (GDS). Because of the fixed nature of the camera, stereo was not possible with ICC.
